elements.title: What Makes a Cult a Cult?
elements.contents:

Today’s essential reads

What Makes a Cult a Cult?

The New Yorker · 19 min

The line between delusion and what the rest of us believe may be blurrier than we think.

Why roads in the Pacific Northwest buckled under extreme heat

The Verge · 5 min

Keep parents out of it: the expert who wants schools to give up weekly spelling tests

The Guardian · 4 min

A Disparaging Video Prompts Explosive Fallout Within ESPN

The New York Times · 13 min

How TikTok's 'Glitch Queen' created the app's hottest dance of the summer with no prior dance training

insider.com · 3 min

Fascinating stories

Train Your Brain to Remember Anything You Learn With This Simple, 20-Minute Habit

Inc. · 3 min

This 100-year-old method has been making the rounds again—it’s worth getting around to.

Why I’m glad that I’m an ‘overthinker’

The Guardian · 7 min

The first time I remember someone telling me not to overthink was when I was trying to suss out breastfeeding. “Don’t overthink it,” said my friend, “just go with it.” “Just going with it” is not something I do.

Lies and honest mistakes

Aeon · 13 min

Our crisis of public knowledge is an ethical crisis. Rewarding ‘truthfulness’ above ‘truth’ is a step towards a solution.

The One Phrase That Can Transform Your Effectiveness at Work

Fast Company · 3 min

Two words, used alone or prefacing a question, can help you connect better with your coworkers and boss.

The Pandemic Did Not Affect Mental Health the Way You Think

The Atlantic · 6 min

The world’s psychological immune system turned out to be more robust than expected.

Britney Spears and Sinéad O'Connor: A Tale of Two Haircuts

Time · 6 min

To quote Phoebe Waller-Bridge’s character, Fleabag, “hair is everything,” but it’s not permanent.

Here’s Why Your Body Stores More Fat in Certain Places

Popular Science · 6 min

A Global Smart-City Competition Highlights China’s Rise in AI

WIRED · 5 min

“You Can’t Actually Blow Up the White House”: An Oral History of ‘Independence Day’

The Hollywood Reporter · 30 min

Japan’s Unusual Way to View the World

BBC Travel · 8 min

Use the button to build your personal library of articles right in Pocket. Read them when you’re free in a quiet, calm space.

Start your library

Writing Can Help Us Heal from Trauma

Harvard Business Review · 10 min

Research suggests that trauma damages brain tissue, but that when people translate their emotional experience into words, they may be changing the way it is organized in the brain.

The 3,000-Year-Old Bones of a Master Ceramicist Show Unusual Signs of Wear

Smithsonian Magazine · 3 min

After analyzing the woman’s skeleton, researchers unlocked her past as an ancient Greek artisan.

Why Water Is Weird

Nautilus · 4 min

What makes water unique among liquids?

America’s Most Flamboyant Private Eye and the 8,000-Mile Manhunt

Narratively · 44 min

Jay J. Armes is a legendary and controversial Texan investigator with hooks for hands and six decades chasing criminals. This was his most epic murder case ever.

How Einstein Learned Physics

Scott Young · 11 min

Einstein was a student long before he became a celebrity. There is a lot to glean from his education and unique approach to learning.
